required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: : A Study to Evaluate the Effect of Testosterone Replacement Therapy (TRT) on the Incidence of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) and Efficacy Measures in Hypogonadal Men ( TRAVERSE )
clinical_study.official_title: Testosterone Replacement Therapy for Assessment of Long-term Vascular Events and Efficacy ResponSE in Hypogonadal Men (TRAVERSE) Study

collaborator.agency: Acerus Pharmaceuticals Corporation/ Aytu Biosciences Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a blinded and placebo-controlled study of topical testosterone replacement therapy (TRT) in symptomatic hypogonadal men with increased risk for cardiovascular (CV) disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Major Adverse Cardiac Event (MACE)
primary_outcome.description: It is defined as time from randomization to first component event occurrence of the composite MACE endpoint. MACE is defined as a composite endpoint consisting of any of the following: nonfatal myocardial infarction (MI), nonfatal stroke or death due to cardiovascular (CV) causes.

secondary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular safety is time from randomization to first component event occurrence of the composite endpoint consisting of the following: nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, death due to CV causes or cardiac revascularization procedures/ cardiac percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and coronary artery bypass graft (CABG).
It is assessed by the incidence of high grade prostate cancer.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in overall sexual activity per Psychosexual Daily Questionnaire (PDQ)
other_outcome.time_frame: From month 0 (baseline) to study completion (approximately month 60)
other_outcome.description: Improvement in sexual activity in hypogonadal men with low libido will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of men whose persistent depressive disorder (PDD) remits during intervention per remission definition
other_outcome.description: Remission of depression in hypogonadal men with late-onset, low grade persistent depressive disorder (PDD) (dysthymia) will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of men with bone fractures
other_outcome.description: Reduction in incidence of clinical fractures will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of anemic men whose anemia is corrected during the intervention period
other_outcome.description: Correction of anemia in subset of participants with baseline anemia will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of men, who had pre-diabetes at Baseline, and who progress to diabetes
other_outcome.description: Reduction in progression from pre-diabetes to diabetes in subset of participants with pre-diabetes at baseline will be assessed.

intervention.description: A matching placebo to testosterone will be administered topically.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men between 45 and 80 years age
- Participants with low serum testosterone concentrations (< 300 ng/dL) who exhibit at least one sign or symptom of hypogonadism and have evidence of cardiovascular (CV) disease or are at an increased risk for CV disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with congenital or acquired hypogonadism for whom long-term therapy with placebo would not be medically appropriate
- Participants with prostate specific antigen (PSA) > 3.0 ng/mL (or 1.5 if on 5-alpha reductase inhibitors)
- Participants who have been treated with testosterone in the past 6 months and for whom testosterone therapy is contraindicated
- Confirmed testosterone < 100 ng/dL
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 50
- Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1C) > 11%
- Hematocrit (Hct) > 50%
- Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) < 30 ml/min
- History of deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism or prostate cancer or heart failure (Class III and IV).
